com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Graphics

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Graphics
public class Graphics
extends java.lang.Object

This is the graphics class and indicates the graphic context corresponding to the canvas.
The lock method and unlock method must be used as a pair. When the lock method has been called from the Canvas.paint method, the unlock method must always be called from the same method. When the frame is switched without the buffer being flushed and is then displayed again, the status will be implementation-dependent. In a typical implementation, the buffer is flushed immediately after the Canvas.paint method was called.
Minimum Specifications:
In minimum specifications, fillPolygon shall be able to paint polygons with up to 16 vertexes.

Method Detail

copy

public Graphics copy()
This generates a copy of a graphics object. The set attributes are copied as they are.

Returns:
A copy of the graphics object. When a copy cannot be produced, null shall be returned.

dispose

public void dispose()
This disposes of the graphics context.
When methods other than dispose are called after calling this method, a UIException is generated (ILLEGAL_STATE). When the dispose method is called after calling this method, it does not do anything.

clearRect

public void clearRect(int x,
                      int y,
                      int width,
                      int height)
This fills a rectangular area with the background color. This method fills the area (width, height) comprised of the upper left (x, y) and lower right (x+width-1, y+height-1) with the background color. When either width or height is positive and the other is 0 or both are 0, it does not draw. Exceptions occur when either the width or height is less than 0.

Parameters:
x - Designates the x coordinate of the upper the left of the rectangular.
y - Designates the y coordinate of the upper left of the rectangular.
width - Designates the width of the rectangle.
height - Designates the height of rectangle.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when 0 is designated for either or both of the arguments "width." or "height".
See Also:
Frame.setBackground(int)

drawLine

public void drawLine(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2)
This draws straight lines. It draws lines (x1, y1)-(x2, y2) with the color designated by the setColor method.

Parameters:
x1 - Designates the x-coordinate of the starting point of the line
y1 - Designates the y-coordinate of the starting point of the line
x2 - Designates the x-coordinate of the end point of the line
y2 - Designates the y-coordinate of the end point of the line

drawRect

public void drawRect(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
This draws a rectangle. This method draws a rectangle designated by upper left (x, y) and lower right (x+width, y+height) with the color set by the setColor method. Exceptions occur when either width or height is less than 0.

Parameters:
x - Designates the x-coordinate of the upper left of the rectangle
y - Designates the y-coordinate of the upper left of rectangle
width - Designates the width of the rectangle
height - Designates the height of the rectangle
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a value less than 0 is designated for either or both the arguments width and height.

drawString

public void drawString(java.lang.String str,
                       int x,
                       int y)
This draws character strings. It draws character strings with the color designated by setColor method. Exception generated when "str" is "null." The drawing location designates the coordinate of baseline.

Parameters:
str - Designates character string to be drawn
x - Designates x-coordinate
y - Designates y-coordinate
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when "null" is designated for parameter "str"

drawChars

public void drawChars(char[] datast,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int off,
                      int len)
This draws a part of a character string. Exception generated when parameter "data" is "null." The drawing is conducted with the color designated by the setColor method. The drawing location designates the coordinate of baseline.

Parameters:
x - Designates x-coordinate
y - Designates y-coordinate
off - Designates the offset of character string to be drawn
len - Designates the length of character string to be drawn
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when "null" is designated for parameter "data"
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value is designated for parameter "off," when a negative value is set for parameter "len" or when the value of parameter "off" or the sum of "off" and "len" is larger than the alignment size

fillRect

public void fillRect(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
This fills the rectangular area. This method fills the area (width, height) comprised of upper left (x, y) and lower right (x+width-1, y+height-1) with the color set by the setColor method. When either width or height is positive and the other is 0 or both are 0, it does not draw. Exceptions are generated when either width or height is, or both are, less than 0.

Parameters:
x - Designates the x-coordinate of the upper left of rectangle
y - Designates the y-coordinate of the upper left of rectangle
width - Designates the width of the rectangle
height - Designates the height of rectangle
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a value less than 0 is designated for either width or height or both the argument.

drawPolyline

public void drawPolyline(int[] xPoints,
                         int[] yPoints,
                         int nPoints)
This draws a polyline linking designated points. It draws the polyline connecting the points designated by arguments with the color designated by the setColor method. However, when the first point designated and the last point designated are different, then no line is drawn between these two points. When the array size designated by the argument is larger than the total number of points designated by the arguments, the number of elements equal to the total number of points shall be used from the beginning of the array. When nPoints is 0, nothing is drawn. And when the number of points is 1, a dot is drawn.

Parameters:
xPoints - x-coordinate array of points
yPoints - y-coordinate array of points
nPoints - Total number of points
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for either argument "xPoints" or "yPoints" or both
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value is designated for the argument "nPoints" or when the array size is smaller than the value designated by the argument "nPoints"

fillPolygon

public void fillPolygon(int[] xPoints,
                        int[] yPoints,
                        int nPoints)
This fills a polygon. It fills the polygon comprised of the vertexes designated by parameters with the color designated by setColor method. In the minimum specifications, it can fill a polygon with up to 16 vertexes. When the alignment size designated by parameters is smaller than the total number of vertex designated by parameters, the factors equal to the total number of vertex will be used from the beginning of alignment. When nPoint is less than 3, it does not draw anything. The behavior when it is impossible to fill a polygon because there are more than 16 vertexes is implementation-dependent.

Parameters:
xPoints - Alignment of x-coordinate
yPoints - Alignment of y-coordinate
nPoints - Total number of vertex
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when "null" is designated for either parameter "xPoints" or "yPoints" or both
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value is designated for parameter "nPoints" or when the alignment size is smaller than the value designated by parameter "nPoints"

drawImage

public void drawImage(Image image,
                      int x,
                      int y)
This draws an image.

Parameters:
image - Designates the image object to be drawn.
x - Designates the x-coordinate.
y - Designates the y-coordinate.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument image
UIException - Generated when a disposed image is designated for the argument image (ILLEGAL_STATE)

getColorOfName

public static int getColorOfName(int name)
This designates the name and obtains the integer that indicates the color corresponding to the name.

Parameters:
name - Designates the value that indicates a color name defined by this class
Returns:
An integer that indicates a color. Although the value to be returned is implementation dependent, the value is not a negative figure. Exceptions shall be generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument name. Specifically when a value other than a value that corresponds to a color as defined in this class (such as Graphics.BLACK, Graphics.BLUE) is designated, an exception is generated.

getColorOfRGB

public static int getColorOfRGB(int r,
                                int g,
                                int b)
This designates the RGB value and obtains an integer indicating a color corresponding to the designated RGB value. Exceptions shall be generated when an argument is less than 0 or larger than 255.

Parameters:
r - Designates the brightness of red elements
g - Designates the brightness of green elements
b - Designates the brightness of blue elements
Returns:
An integer that indicates a color. Although the value to be returned is implementation-dependent, the value is not a negative number.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a value outside the set range is designated for arguments r, g and b

setColor

public void setColor(int color)
This sets the color to be used for drawing. In the default setting, an implementation dependent color which contrasts with the background color of the canvas is set, when a Graphics object is generated by the getGraphics method.

Parameters:
color - Designates the color to be used for drawing.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for argument c.

setFont

public void setFont(Font f)
This sets the font to be used for drawing. The font to be returned by getDefaultFont method of the Font class is set for a Graphics object as default. When null is designated as an argument, an exception shall be generated.

Parameters:
f - Designates the font to be used for drawing
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for argument f.
See Also:
Font.getDefaultFont()

setOrigin

public void setOrigin(int x,
                      int y)
This sets the orignin coordinates for drawing. When drawing methods such as drawLine() are called, drawing is conducted at the coordinate that is the sum of the coordinate value passed to the argument and the offset value designated by this method. To return the coordinate origin to default, designate 0 for both x and y and call this method. Default is set as (0, 0).

Parameters:
x - Designates the offset value in the x direction
y - Designates the offset valuein the y direction

lock

public void lock()
This declares the start of double buffering to the drawing device. This adds 1 to the lock count to buffer drawing process thereafter.

See Also:
unlock(boolean)

unlock

public void unlock(boolean forced)
This declares the end of double buffering to the drawing device. This subtracts 1 from the lock count when it is greater than zero and conduct the following operations.
  • When true is passed to forced, the buffer is flushed and the lock count is set to be 0.
  • When false is passed to forced, the buffer is flushed only when the lock count is 0.
If this method is called when the lock count is 0, this method shall do nothing.

Parameters:
forced - Designates whether or not forced flushing shall be conducted.
See Also:
lock()

setPictoColorEnabled

public void setPictoColorEnabled(boolean b)
This sets whether the color set for graphics is valid for pictorial character drawing. When "true" is designated, the pictorial character drawing is conducted with the color designated by setColor method. When "false" is designated, the pictorial character drawing is conducted with default color. Default color the color for each pictorial color preset by each system. Default value is "false."

Parameters:
b - Designates "true" to draw the pictorial character with the designated color, or "false" to draw with default color.
